intro: Rytigynia nodulosa, commonly known as the nodular rytigynia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Rytigyniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has compound leaves with serrated edges. Its botanical features include small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, and it is often found in lowland rainforests. Rytigynia nodulosa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
